dublin_core.dcvalue: This article describes the design and implementation of an online diabetes self management intervention for a sample of inner city African Americans with diabetes Study participants were randomly assigned to the treatment 26 and control 21 conditions The results indicate that treatment group participants were more likely to achieve positive outcomes in terms of lowered hemoglobin A1c and body mass index measurements than were control group members These findings support the development of telehealth interventions to promote effective chronic disease management in medically underserved communities
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:29:00Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2011-02-10
Perspectives in health information management / AHIMA, American Health Information Management Association
A patient-centric, provider-assisted diabetes telehealth self-management intervention for urban minorities.
